DOC.brief_summary: This is a prospective phase II study of peri-operative docetaxel plus laparoscopic radical prostatectomy in patients with localized Gleason 7 pT2a-pT2b adenocarcinoma of the prostate and a risk of relapse after radical prostatectomy.
DOC.brief_title: Study of Peri-Operative Docetaxel Plus Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy in Prostate Cancer Patients
DOC.criteria: Patients older than 18 years and less than 70 years Histologicallyproven Gleason 7 adenocarcinoma of the prostate pT2a or pT2b disease based on biopsies of the prostate More than 2/3 of positive biopsies or 15 ≤ serum PSA <20 No previous carcinoma, except basalcell carcinoma of the skin Adequate renal function: measured or calculated creatinine clearance> 60 ml/min Absolute granulocyte count ≥ 1,500/mm3, platelets ≥ 100,000 mm3, bilirubin ≤ 1.5 fold the upper normal value Signed informed consent. Patients infected by the Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) Contraindication to general anesthesia or surgery Patients who do not fit inclusion criteria
DOC.keyword: Patients with localized Gleason 7 pT2a-pT2b adenocarcinoma of the prostate
